title: Death of the holy man, death of a genre: the life of Cyril Phileotes by Nicholas Katakepenos
abstractText:
This project attempts an answer to two interrelated problems of the twelfth century In the Byzantine empire: 1) Why the relationship between empire and holy man, so crucial to the empire in earlier periods, appears to break down,
2) Why saints' lives, a staple of Byzantine literature in earlier periods, cease to be written. In finding the answer, the whole question of the relationship between history and literature, or society and culture, is explored. A crucial text, the Life of Cyril Phileotes by Nicholas Kataskepenos, one of the last of the saints' lives, about one of the last of the holy men of the period is analysed to provide examples.
